articles.title: Argentina's soy sell-off continues, but sales expected to slow
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Sept 20 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers continued to offload soy stockpiles last week following a series of carrot-and-stick measures aimed at spurring exports, with 61.8% of the 2021/2022 harvest sold by the end of the week, the agriculture ministry said on Tuesday.Between Sept. 8 and 14, producers sold 2.3 million tonnes of the 2021/2022 harvest, up from 2.1

articles.content:
DURBAN, South Africa (AP) — South Africa was forced to select 35-year-old veteran Frans Steyn at flyhalf on Tuesday for the decisive final game of the Rugby Championship against Argentina.

articles.title: In land of Maradona and Messi, fans jostle for World Cup stickers
articles.description: In convenience stores around Argentina, kids - and their parents - are caught up in a new craze: the hunt for soccer World Cup stickers that have driven the already sport-mad country into a frenzy and left many shops with no stock left to sell.

articles.title: Analysis: In Latin America, democracies shaken ahead of key elections
articles.description: An assassination attempt in Argentina and spurts of election-linked violence in Brazil have emerged as the latest signs of growing political discontent in Latin America, creating a treacherous environment for incumbents of all stripes.
